str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To rise up together against. From sun and ephistemi; to stand up together, i.e. To resist jointly.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the base of stratia and ago or hegeomai; a general, i.e. a governor, the chief of the temple-wardens.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To command, order, direct, bid. From a primary kello; 'hail'; to incite by word, i.e. Order.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To tear off, as of garments. From peri and rhegnumi; to tear all around, i.e. Completely away.
To beat with rods, scourge. From rhabdos; to strike with a stick, i.e. Bastinado.
